required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Care Coordination for Adolescents and Young Adults With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Care Coordination for Adolescents and Young Adults With Cancer: Implementing a Bridge Between Needs and Services

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to test an intervention designed to identify cancer needs and connect patients with services that address those needs. Participation in this research will involve completing 2 online surveys over the course of 1 month; each should take about 15 minutes to complete.

detailed_description.textblock:
Adolescents and young Adults (AYA) Needs Assessment & Service Bridge (AYA NA-SB) includes a holistic Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROM) assessing AYAs' physical, psychosocial and practical needs and a collection of referral pathways for connecting AYAs to services and resources based on the needs they report.
To assess the implementation of AYA NA-SB, the study team will pilot AYA NA-SB in the North Carolina Cancer Hospital (NCCH)/ UNC Children's Hospital, with a primary focus on implementation outcomes (i.e., feasibility, acceptability, appropriateness, fidelity). To establish proof-of-concept for AYA NA-SB, the study team will use pilot data to generate preliminary evidence on the extent to which AYA NA-SB addresses AYAs' reported needs.

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire measuring the extent to which AYA NA-SB can be successfully used in cancer programs. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with higher score denoting higher feasibility.
Questionnaire measuring the extent to which AYA NA-SB can be successfully used in cancer programs. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score denoting higher feasibility.
Questionnaire measuring perception of whether AYA-NA-SB is agreeable, palatable, or satisfactory to users. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score denoting higher acceptability.
Questionnaire measuring perception of whether AYA-NA-SB is agreeable, palatable, or satisfactory to users. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score denoting higher acceptability.

Questionnaire measuring perception of AYA-NA-SB's fit, relevance, or compatibility with the context in which it will be used. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score denoting higher appropriateness

Questionnaire measuring perception of AYA-NA-SB's fit, relevance, or compatibility with the context in which it will be used. Score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score denoting higher appropriateness

primary_outcome.measure: Fidelity-Proportion of Needs Assessment Reviewed by Provider
primary_outcome.description: Fidelity assessed by proportion of needs assessment reviewed by provider within one week
Fidelity assessed by number of referral pathways Initiated

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of AYAs Who Received Services
primary_outcome.description: Care coordination will be assessed by the proportion of AYAs who received services from across disciplines to address reported needs within one month of needs assessment completion.
Questionnaire assessing AYAs' perception of the degree to which their needs were adequately addressed during the study period. Scores range from 1 to 5 where higher scores denote that needs were met.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative analysis of perceived determinants based on CFIR constructs
secondary_outcome.description: Interviews will be coded by constructs from the Consolidated Framework of Implementation Research (CFIR) to report identified barriers and their perceived level of influence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative analysis of strategies used and their perceived level of influence
secondary_outcome.description: Interviews will be analyzed inductively to report on implementation strategies used and their perceived level of influence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of AYA Needs by Domain
secondary_outcome.description: Number of AYAs reporting needs in each of 9 domains
services and resources rendered in response to needs reported by AYAs

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of AYA needs reported by item
secondary_outcome.description: number of AYAs reporting each need

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adolescents and Young Adults Needs Assessment & Service Bridge (AYA NA-SB)
arm_group.description: Subjects will complete 2 online surveys over the course of 1 month; each should take about 15 minutes to complete.

intervention.description: Questionnaire identifying cancer needs so that providers can connect subjects with services that might address them.
intervention.arm_group_label: Adolescents and Young Adults Needs Assessment & Service Bridge (AYA NA-SB)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AYAs with cancer ages 18 through 39 currently undergoing cancer treatment at the North Carolina Cancer Hospital/ UNC Children's Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who decline to participate in the study
